alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 26 at 4:28AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Missouri...Iowa... Mississippi River at Gregory Landing affecting Hancock and Clark Counties. Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Henderson, Louisa, Mercer and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Mercer and Louisa Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Muscatine, Louisa, Mercer and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Muscatine, Rock Island and Scott Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Rock Island and Scott Counties. Mississippi River at Fulton LD13 affecting Whiteside, Clinton and Carroll Counties. Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12 affecting Jackson, Jo Daviess, Clinton and Carroll Counties. Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Whiteside, Rock Island, Scott and Clinton Counties. Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Hancock, Henderson, Lee and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Henderson and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Jo Daviess, Jackson and Dubuque Counties. Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19 affecting Hancock, Clark and Lee Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...The river is approaching minor flood stage and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19. * WHEN...From late Thursday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.4 feet, U.S. Highway 61 closes at the bridge over the Des Moines River between Alexandria and Keokuk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:40 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.5 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning and continue rising to 18.1 feet by next Tuesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon.
